intro: Merremia hungaiensis, commonly known as the Kgalagadi morning glory, is a climbing vine native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky areas and along riverbanks. Merremia hungaiensis is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
